title.narrative: VIOLENCE PREVENTION MODELS

description.narrative: By 2022, social sector institutions will have strengthened their capacities to efficiently and innovatively design, manage, monitor and evaluate public policies in areas linked to the Cooperation Program., which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most vulnerable and excluded children and adolescents live in violence-free environments and benefit from effective, innovative and non-discriminatory policies and programmes that guarantee equality of opportunities for their integral protection.

FUNDACION DE UNIVERSIDAD COSTA RICA PARA LA INVESTIGACION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, social sector institutions will have strengthened their capacities to efficiently and innovatively design, manage, monitorand evaluate public policies in areas linked to the Cooperation Program.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF contributed to the development of 5;integral child protection models for violence prevention and response. It promoted 2 new models focused on migrant children, and scaled up 3 models (judicial mentoring model, foster family model, family reintegration and independent living model (HALCOM) and Child Friendly Cities Models (CAI). The actions were developed jointly with the Local Protection Subsystems (SSLPs) ;in coordination with the National Comprehensive Protection System (SNPI), with whom regions and challenges were prioritized on the basis of the Child and Adolescent Well-being Index (IBINA) published by UNICEF and MIDEPLAN in 2021. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of innovative violence prevention models implemented(57838), Number
Number of SSLPs (individuals, NGOs and institutions) supported by UNICEF in the implemention of innovative violence prevention models.(57839)

Country has a national, multi-sectoral plan(s) or strategy(ies) for coordinated action to prevent and respond to violence against children that meets key criteria for quality, according to status of plan., Text

baseline.value: The country has a National Plan against Violence, its monitoring will be done through institutional commitments, in the CNNA.

target.value: 2022:The office will provide support for the implementation of the Plan, through the establishment of monitoring mechanisms.

actual.value: 2021:Four models were developed with PANI: foster care, family reintegration, life project, transition to independent life. Additionally, the model of judicial mentors was started with the judiciary Branch
